Genwi.Helpers.name: Genwi.Helpers
Genwi.Helpers.description:
This is the helpers class object containing all the handlebars helper.
To register a specific set of helpers use the following statement.
Genwi.Helpers.initialise(["helper1_name","helper2_name",..,])

Genwi.Template.name: Genwi.Template
Genwi.Template.description:
This whole thing is essentially a very stripped down Backbone.js, since our Router and
to a large extent Model are already taken care of by native. All it does is take Backbone's 
subclassing and adds in an abstract class that can be used to build better templates.

Genwi.Template.AbstractView.name: Genwi.Template.AbstractView
Genwi.Template.AbstractView.description:
This is the base class for any page view. It should be treated as an abstract class and
never actually instantiated. To extend this class, do this:
`new Genwi.Template.AbstractView.extend();`

You can also pass attributes directly to the extend function that become part
of your new instance's prototype.

`new Genwi.Template.AbstractView.extend({
	onSomeCallback: function(){ },
	my: 'props'
});`

Genwi.Template.Article.name: Genwi.Template.Article
Genwi.Template.Article.description:
This is the template for the Article page.
Any further specific implmentations should extend this template.

classitems.description: Helper function to return the lowercase value for a string.
classitems.name: lowercase

return.description: the lowercase value of the value.

classitems.description: Helper function to return the lowercase value for a variable.
classitems.name: uppercase

classitems.description:
This is a simple helper to get the substring for a string.
Works similar to javascript string function.
classitems.name: substring

classitems.description:
Return the different fields of time that can be arranged to get date in any format.
Use following fields to map different parts of the date.
date - The present date in number. e.g 29
day - Day in words e.g monday
month_num - The month in number. e.g 11
month -  Month in words e.g January
year - Year in number. e.g 2011
hour - Hours in 12 hr format.
min - Minutes.
sec - Seconds.
clock - AM/PM.
sup, - st/nd/th/rd to represent the date. e.g 1st.
classitems.name: datefields

classitems.description:
This is a simple helper to split a string using a seperator 
and then apply the array to the template.
classitems.name: split

classitems.description:
Strips a text from its html formatting. Uses the jquery function to do so. 
We also wrap the text here to allow some simple string be in the argument.
classitems.name: rawtext

return.description: The raw string without any html tags.

classitems.description: This is a helper function to iterate over a an array for a particular subset.

params.name: The
params.description: array object

params.name: The
params.description: start position

params.name: the
params.description: number by which the length should be shortened to

params.name: The
params.description: context which has the template to apply

classitems.description:
This helper compares two value depending on the operator type passed. 
If the result is true applies the template inside compare otherwise applies the else part.
classitems.name: compare

params.name: The
params.description: left value to compare.

params.name: The
params.description: right hand side value to compare.

params.name: type
params.description: The operator type - eq or neq.

classitems.description:
Initialises the helper using the list of helpers passed.
Pass an empty array or no argument if you want all the helpers to be registered.
classitems.name: initialise

params.name: helpers-
params.description: Comma seperated list of the name of the helpers.

classitems.description:
A global constants object to define any constants.
Any constants should not be directly hardcoded as per requirements but defined
here first so that we have maintainable code.
Use this function to register your html template with the javascript prototype.
classitems.name: registerTemplate

params.name: templateName
params.description: [The name of the html template.]

params.name: jsPrototype
params.description: [The name of the prototype]

params.name: options
params.description: Optional object passed from html which will be available to the prototype.

classitems.description:
Use this function to register settings of your template.
Presently valid only for toolbar and sections template.
classitems.name: registerSettings

classitems.description:
The name of the html template to which this prototype's object will be binded to.
See Genwi.Template.registerTemplate
classitems.name: templateName

classitems.description:
Optional options object which will be initialised if passed from html template.
See Genwi.Template.registerTemplate
classitems.name: options

classitems.description: This represent the data that would be binded to the corresponding html template.
classitems.name: model

classitems.description: True if running in iOS.
classitems.name: isIOS

classitems.description: True if runnning in android.
classitems.name: isAndroid

classitems.description: True if runnning in Ipad.
classitems.name: isIpad

classitems.description: True if runnning in Iphone.
classitems.name: isIphone

classitems.description: True if its a native app and not html5
True if runnning in Android smart phone.
classitems.name: isAndroidSmartPhone

classitems.description: True if runnning in Android Tablet.
classitems.name: isAndroidTablet

classitems.description: CSS selector for this view's template
classitems.name: rootTemplateId

classitems.description: CSS selector for this view's root container
classitems.name: el

classitems.description: Cached jQuery selector for this view's root container
classitems.name: elOb

classitems.description: Sets the variable to identify the running environment.

This is the starting point for client rendering.
Wraps a sequence of calls which perform the exact logical functions.
Override this only in the case of very specialised requirement which is
not solved by overriding other functions.
classitems.name: init

params.name: context
params.description: The DOM element under which the template layout will resides.

classitems.description:
Prepares the data which will be binded to the template as defined in the html file.
Override this if the data available through this default implementation does not cater to your needs.
classitems.name: buildModel

classitems.description:
Any miscellaneous task before actually drawing the page should be carried out here.
A common use case is creating some DOM element dynamically.
classitems.name: onDraw

classitems.description:
This checks and sets up the dom layout according to how the framework works.
Missing root elements, configuring html5 context and setting up default native scroll falls under this function presently.

Binds the data to the inline template in the html file.
Override this if data has to be binded in a custom way.
classitems.name: draw

params.name: inc
params.description:
True if the data has to be appended to the root DOM.
                       Default is false.

classitems.description: This function is called by native at various stages of a running app.

params.name: response
params.description: The data passed from native.

classitems.description:
Called when a page is loaded on the client device fresh from the server.
Any post-load event or miscellaneous task should be carried out here.
classitems.name: onPageLoaded

classitems.description:
Called when the page is loaded from cache on the client.
A common use case is when you click back button.
classitems.name: onPageLoadedFromCache

classitems.description:
Called when native sends some response to the client in return of some request made.
A common use case is return of posts when client raises appsurl/fetch request.
classitems.name: onResponseReceived

classitems.description: This is called to get the current page context as required by toolbar.
This method prepares the actual context which can be app specific.
classitems.name: pageContext

return.description: object with all the data to be passed to be set as context.

classitems.description:
Wrapper function for onAppUpdate.
Binds the different system updates with intuitive values.

params.name: resp
params.description: The response from the native specifying different type of updates happened.

classitems.description:
This function is called when the app is updated from background to foreground.
Override this function to implement in your app.
There are four types of updates that can happen
and will be passed as an array - ['ads', 'category','content','design']
classitems.name: onAppUpdate

params.name: updates
params.description: - All updated passed as an array.

classitems.description:
This function tells the native that client has finished loading after which
the native platform actually shows the page to the user.
Binds the orientation change event to the app.

This is called when orientation is changed for the device.
Implement this to handle any orientation change usecases.
classitems.name: onOrientationChange

classitems.description:
This method is called on every article,articles,categories,favorite and search page.
The data passed from getcontext will be transferred here as json data which can be used to
for further toolbar modification.
classitems.name: setContext

params.name: resp
params.description: The data returned from getContext of the particular page.

classitems.description:
This utility is to load the images after the layout is done.
Image tags or div tag(background image) should fullfill following requirement

  1. data-src attribute set to url of the image

  e.g Genwi.Utils.lazyLoad($(".lazyElements"));
classitems.name: lazyLoad

classitems.description: Fills up a basic handlebar template.
classitems.name: bindTmplData

params.name: templateId
params.description: -  The Id of the handlebar template

params.name: context
params.description: - The context to fill up the template.

params.name: elementToAppend
params.description: - The element where the final layout should be appended to.

params.name: append
params.description: [Append original contents. True to append, false otherwise.]
